entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 6:45PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RIVER RISES DUE TO MELTING SNOWPACK... UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE OVER THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS HAS RESULTED IN EXCESSIVE SNOWMELT AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS A RESULT, WATER LEVELS IN RIVERS AND STREAMS THAT HAVE THEIR ORIGINS IN THE MOUNTAINS HAVE BEEN RISING SINCE THIS PAST SUNDAY AND CONTINUE TO RISE TODAY. GREATEST RATES OF RISE ARE
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 12:43AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A very moist air mass is in place across the High Plains with dew point values in the 60s to mid 70s resulting in precipitable water values of 1.25 to 1.75 inches. Thunderstorm chances increase during the late afternoon Wednesday and last through late morning Thursday. Heavy to torrential rainfall is expected which would exacerbate already saturated soils in the watch area.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 1:43AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A very moist air mass is in place across the High Plains with dew point values in the 60s to mid 70s resulting in precipitable water values of 1.25 to 1.75 inches. Thunderstorm chances increase during the late afternoon Wednesday and last through late morning Thursday. Heavy to torrential rainfall is expected which would exacerbate already saturated soils in the watch area.
